001package io.jstach.ezkv.kvs;
002
003import java.io.ByteArrayInputStream;
004import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
005import java.io.IOException;
006import java.io.InputStream;
007import java.io.UncheckedIOException;
008import java.net.URI;
009import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets;
010import java.util.Optional;
011import java.util.Properties;
012import java.util.function.BiConsumer;
013
014import org.jspecify.annotations.Nullable;
015
016import io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesServiceProvider.KeyValuesMediaFinder;
017
018/**
019 * Represents a media type for parsing and formatting key-value pairs. A
020 * {@code KeyValuesMedia} provides parsing and formatting capabilities for specific media
021 * types and can be searched based on file extensions or media types.
022 *
023 * <p>
024 * Out-of-the-box implementations include properties and URL-encoded formats. <strong>The
025 * properties and URL encoded formats do maintain order of the key values parsed and do
026 * allow duplicate keys (unlike regular java.util {@link Properties})! </strong>
027 * <p>
028 * Example usage for parsing an {@code InputStream}:
029 * {@snippet :
030 * KeyValuesMedia propertiesMedia = KeyValuesMedia.ofProperties();
031 * KeyValues parsedKeyValues = propertiesMedia.parser().parse(resource, inputStream);
032 * }
033 * For a formal specification of media types see:
034 * <a href="https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6838"> Media Type Specifications and
035 * Registration Procedures RFC 6838 </a>
036 * <p>
037 * All KeyValuesMedia implement {@link KeyValuesMediaFinder} and thus each media can be
038 * queried if it is a match of file extension of media type. When a
039 * {@link KeyValuesSystem} is fully loaded it will have a list of all found
040 * {@link KeyValuesMedia} and create a composite {@link KeyValuesMediaFinder}.
041 *
042 * @see KeyValues
043 * @see Parser
044 * @see Formatter
045 * @see #ofProperties()
046 * @see #ofUrlEncoded()
047 * @see KeyValuesSystem#mediaFinder()
048 * @see KeyValuesResource#mediaType()
049 * @see KeyValuesResource#KEY_MEDIA_TYPE
050 */
051public interface KeyValuesMedia extends KeyValuesMediaFinder {
052
053        /**
054         * Media Type for {@link Properties}.
055         */
056        public static String MEDIA_TYPE_PROPERTIES = "text/x-java-properties";
057
058        /**
059         * Media Type for URL encoded pairs which is almost entirely compatible with URI
060         * percent encoding.
061         */
062        public static String MEDIA_TYPE_URLENCODED = "application/x-www-form-urlencoded";
063
064        /**
065         * File extension for {@link Properties} files.
066         */
067        public static String FILE_EXT_PROPERTIES = "properties";
068
069        /**
070         * Returns the media type as a string and should ideally be in
071         * <a href="https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6838">rfc6838 format</a>, is
072         * required and should be unique from other {@link KeyValuesMedia} unlike
073         * {@link #getFileExt()}.
074         * @return the media type
075         */
076        public String getMediaType();
077
078        /**
079         * Returns the file extension associated with the media type, if any.
080         * @return the file extension or {@code null} if not applicable
081         */
082        public @Nullable String getFileExt();
083
084        /**
085         * Returns a {@link Parser} for parsing key-value pairs from an input stream.
086         * @return the parser
087         */
088        public Parser parser();
089
090        /**
091         * Returns a parser that maybe customized by parameters. By default {@link #parser()}
092         * is called.
093         * @param parameters parameters that can come from
094         * {@link KeyValuesResource#parameters()}.
095         * @return parser
096         */
097        default Parser parser(Variables parameters) {
098                return parser();
099        }
100
101        /**
102         * Returns a {@link Formatter} for formatting key-value pairs to an appendable target.
103         * By default, this method throws {@link UnsupportedOperationException} if formatting
104         * is not supported.
105         * @return the formatter
106         * @throws UnsupportedOperationException if formatting is not supported
107         */
108        default Formatter formatter() throws UnsupportedOperationException {
109                throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
110        }
111
112        /**
113         * Returns a {@code KeyValuesMedia} instance for the {@link Properties} format however
114         * unlike normal {@link Properties} order of the properties key values is maintained
115         * based on the order parsed and <strong>duplicate key names are allowed</strong>.
116         * @return a properties format media type
117         */
118        public static KeyValuesMedia ofProperties() {
119                return DefaultKeyValuesMedia.PROPERTIES;
120        }
121
122        /**
123         * Returns a {@code KeyValuesMedia} instance for the URL-encoded format.
124         * @return a URL-encoded format media type
125         */
126        public static KeyValuesMedia ofUrlEncoded() {
127                return DefaultKeyValuesMedia.URLENCODED;
128        }
129
130        @Override
131        default Optional<KeyValuesMedia> findByExt(String ext) {
132                if (ext.equalsIgnoreCase(getFileExt())) {
133                        return Optional.of(this);
134                }
135                return Optional.empty();
136        }
137
138        @Override
139        default Optional<KeyValuesMedia> findByMediaType(String mediaType) {
140                if (getMediaType().equalsIgnoreCase(mediaType)) {
141                        return Optional.of(this);
142                }
143                return Optional.empty();
144        }
145
146        @Override
147        default Optional<KeyValuesMedia> findByUri(URI uri) {
148                if (hasFileExt(uri)) {
149                        return Optional.of(this);
150                }
151                return Optional.empty();
152        }
153
154        /**
155         * Reads an {@link InputStream} and converts it to a UTF-8 encoded string.
156         * @param inputStream the input stream to read which will not be closed by this call.
157         * @return the string representation of the input stream
158         * @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs
159         */
160        public static String inputStreamToString(InputStream inputStream) throws IOException {
161                try (ByteArrayOutputStream result = new ByteArrayOutputStream()) {
162                        inputStream.transferTo(result);
163                        return result.toString(StandardCharsets.UTF_8);
164                }
165
166        }
167
168        /**
169         * A parser for reading key-value pairs from an input source.
170         */
171        public interface Parser {
172
173                /**
174                 * Parses key-value pairs from an input stream and applies them to a consumer.
175                 * @param input the input stream to read from
176                 * @param consumer the consumer to apply the parsed key-value pairs
177                 * @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs during parsing
178                 */
179                void parse(InputStream input, BiConsumer<String, String> consumer) throws IOException;
180
181                /**
182                 * Parses key-value pairs from an input stream and associates them with a given
183                 * resource.
184                 * @param source the resource from which the key-values are sourced
185                 * @param is the input stream to read from
186                 * @return a {@code KeyValues} instance containing the parsed key-value pairs
187                 * @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs during parsing
188                 */
189                default KeyValues parse(KeyValuesResource source, InputStream is) throws IOException {
190                        var b = KeyValues.builder(source);
191                        parse(is, b::add);
192                        return b.build();
193                }
194
195                /**
196                 * Parses key-value pairs from a string and applies them to a consumer.
197                 * @param input the string to parse
198                 * @param consumer the consumer to apply the parsed key-value pairs
199                 */
200                default void parse(String input, BiConsumer<String, String> consumer) {
201                        try {
202                                parse(stringToInputStream(input), consumer);
203                        }
204                        catch (IOException e) {
205                                throw new UncheckedIOException(e);
206                        }
207                }
208
209                /**
210                 * Parses key-value pairs from a string and returns a {@code KeyValues} instance.
211                 * @param input the string to parse
212                 * @return a {@code KeyValues} instance containing the parsed key-value pairs
213                 */
214                default KeyValues parse(String input) {
215                        var b = KeyValues.builder();
216                        parse(input, b::add);
217                        return b.build();
218                }
219
220                private static InputStream stringToInputStream(String s) {
221                        return new ByteArrayInputStream(s.getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_8));
222                }
223
224        }
225
226        /**
227         * A formatter for writing key-value pairs to an output.
228         */
229        public interface Formatter {
230
231                /**
232                 * Formats key-value pairs into the provided {@link Appendable}.
233                 * @param appendable the appendable to write to
234                 * @param kvs the key-value pairs to format
235                 * @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs during formatting
236                 */
237                public void format(Appendable appendable, KeyValues kvs) throws IOException;
238
239                /**
240                 * Formats key-value pairs into a {@link StringBuilder}.
241                 * @param stringBuilder the string builder to write to
242                 * @param kvs the key-value pairs to format
243                 */
244                default void format(StringBuilder stringBuilder, KeyValues kvs) {
245                        try {
246                                format((Appendable) stringBuilder, kvs);
247                        }
248                        catch (IOException e) {
249                                throw new UncheckedIOException(e);
250                        }
251                }
252
253                /**
254                 * Formats key-value pairs and returns them as a string.
255                 * @param kvs the key-value pairs to format
256                 * @return the formatted key-value pairs as a string
257                 */
258                default String format(KeyValues kvs) {
259                        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
260                        format(sb, kvs);
261                        return sb.toString();
262                }
263
264        }
265
266        /**
267         * Checks if a given filename has the file extension associated with this media type.
268         * @param filename the filename to check
269         * @return {@code true} if the filename ends with the media type's file extension,
270         * otherwise {@code false}
271         */
272        default boolean hasFileExt(String filename) {
273                String ext = getFileExt();
274                if (ext == null) {
275                        return false;
276                }
277                return filename.endsWith("." + ext);
278        }
279
280        /**
281         * Checks if the URI's path has the file extension associated with this media type.
282         * @param uri the URI to check
283         * @return {@code true} if the URI's path ends with the media type's file extension,
284         * otherwise {@code false}
285         */
286        default boolean hasFileExt(URI uri) {
287                String p = uri.getPath();
288                if (p == null)
289                        return false;
290                return hasFileExt(p);
291        }
292
293        // default void prettyPrint(StringBuilder sb) {
294        // sb.append(toString()).append("(").append(getMediaType()).append(", ");
295        // var fe = getFileExt();
296        // if (fe != null) {
297        // sb.append(fe);
298        // }
299        // sb.append(")");
300        // }
301
302}
